Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {AEME: Aquatic Ecosystem Model Ensemble},   author = {Authors@R: c and email = "tadhg.moore6@gmail.com") and {person)}},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://expert-guide-29ve1vw.pages.github.io/}, }

title: Aquatic Ecosystem Model Ensemble
text: Aquatic Ecosystem Model Ensemble (AEME) package allows setup run ensemble aquatic ecosystem models. models DYRESM-CAEDYM, GLM-AED GOTM-WET.

title: Aquatic Ecosystem Model Ensemble
text: can install development version AEME GitHub :

title: Aquatic Ecosystem Model Ensemble
text: basic example shows build run one models ensemble: model input output (/O) handled ’s S4 object class aeme. allows standardisation generalisation functions class alongside ensuring integrity validity ’s structure. allows easier handling model output data within structure allows condensed output printed console: Model data can visualised easily using plot_output() function Also, visualising lake level plots.
code: library(AEME) #>  #> Attaching package: 'AEME' #> The following object is masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     time ## basic example code tmpdir <- tempdir() aeme_dir <- system.file("extdata/lake/", package = "AEME") # Copy files from package into tempdir file.copy(aeme_dir, tmpdir, recursive = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE path <- file.path(tmpdir, "lake") aeme_data <- yaml_to_aeme(path = path, "aeme.yaml") #> Linking to GEOS 3.11.2, GDAL 3.6.2, PROJ 9.2.0; sf_use_s2() is FALSE #> Warning in aeme_constructor(lake = yaml$lake, time = yaml$time, configuration = yaml$configuration, : Lake area [152343 m2] is different to the area calculated from the lake #> shape [152433.09 m2]. mod_ctrls <- read.csv(file.path(path, "model_controls.csv")) inf_factor = c("dy_cd" = 1, "glm_aed" = 1, "gotm_wet" = 1) outf_factor = c("dy_cd" = 1, "glm_aed" = 1, "gotm_wet" = 1) model <- c("dy_cd", "glm_aed", "gotm_wet") aeme_data <- build_ensemble(path = path, aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model,                             mod_ctrls = mod_ctrls, inf_factor = inf_factor,                              ext_elev = 5, use_bgc = TRUE) #> Building simulation for Wainamu [2023-11-15 12:29:07.677313] #> Using observed water level #> Missing values in observed water level #> Using optimisation function #> Calculating outflow with an estimated water balance using lake level, #> inflow data (if present) and estimated evaporation rates. #> Calculating lake level using lake depth and a sinisoidal function. #> Observed lake level is present. Updating initial lake model depth... #> Building DYRESM-CAEDYM for lake wainamu #> Copied in DYRESM par file #> Writing DYRESM configuration #> [1] "TEMPTURE SALINITY DO PO4 DOPL POPL PIP TP NH4 NO3 DONL PONL TN DOCL POCL SiO2 CYANO CHLOR FDIAT TCHLA SSOL1" #> Writing DYRESM control file #> Downsampling bathymetry #> Building GLM3-AED2 model for lake wainamu #> Copied in GLM nml file #> Copied in AED nml file #>    oxy_initial   = 625 replaced with 312.5 #>    frp_initial = 0.3229 replaced with 0.3229 #>      dop_initial  = 0.3229 replaced with 0.3229 #>      pop_initial  = 0.3229 replaced with 0.3229 #>    amm_initial = 1.4279 replaced with 1.4279 #>    nit_initial = 1.0709 replaced with 1.0709 #>      don_initial  = 21.4183 replaced with 21.4183 #>      pon_initial  = 7.1394 replaced with 7.1394 #>      doc_initial  = 41.6285 replaced with 41.6285 #>      poc_initial  = 16.6514 replaced with 16.6514 #>    rsi_initial = 1 replaced with 1 #> PHY_cyano 0.24022 replaced with 0.24022 #> PHY_green 0.300275 replaced with 0.300275 #> PHY_diatom 0.300275 replaced with 0.300275 #>     ss_initial   = 3,3 replaced with 3, #> Building GOTM-WET for lake wainamu #> Copied all GOTM configuration files aeme_data <- run_aeme(aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model, verbose = FALSE,                        path = path, parallel = TRUE, mod_ctrls = mod_ctrls) #> Running models in parallel... [2023-11-15 12:29:10.415701] #> Model run complete![2023-11-15 12:31:25.462804] #> Reading models in parallel... [2023-11-15 12:31:26.667304] #> Model reading complete![2023-11-15 12:31:28.732729] class(aeme_data) #> [1] "aeme" #> attr(,"package") #> [1] "AEME" aeme_data #>             AEME  #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Lake #> Wainamu (ID: 45819); Lat: -36.89; Lon: 174.47; Elev: 23.64m; Depth: 13.07m; #> Area: 152343 m2; Shape file: Present #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Time #> Start: 2022-01-09 Stop: 2022-12-30 Time step: 3600 #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Configuration #>           Physical   |   Biogeochemical #> DY-CD    : Present    |   Present #> GLM-AED  : Present    |   Present #> GOTM-WET : Present    |   Present #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Observations #> Lake: Present; Level: Present #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Input #> Inital profile: Present; Inital depth: 13.14m; Hypsograph: Present (n=132); #> Meteo: Present; Use longwave: TRUE; Kw: 0.98 #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Inflows #> Data: Present; Scaling factors: DY-CD: 1; GLM-AED: 1; GOTM-WET: 1 #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Outflows #> Data: Present; Scaling factors: DY-CD: 1; GLM-AED: 1; GOTM-WET: 1 #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Outflows #> Data: Present; Scaling factors: DY-CD: 1; GLM-AED: 1; GOTM-WET: 1 #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Water balance #> Use: obs; Modelled: Absent; Water balance: Present #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Output:  #> DY-CD: Present #> GLM-AED: Present #> GOTM-WET: Present p1 <- plot_output(aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model, var_sim = "HYD_temp",                    level = TRUE, label = TRUE, var_lims = c(9, 30),                    print_plots = FALSE) p1 #> Warning: Using size for a discrete variable is not advised. #> Warning: Removed 80 rows containing missing values (`geom_col()`). p2 <- plot_output(aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model,                            var_sim = "LKE_lvlwtr", level = TRUE, label = TRUE,                          var_lims = c(9, 30), print_plots = FALSE,                           facet = FALSE) p2

title: aeme Class — aeme
aeme Class — aeme
text: class represents data related lake running AEME.

title: aeme Class — aeme
text: lake list representing lake information. time list representing time information. configuration list representing model's configuration. observations list representing observation information. input list representing input information. inflows list representing inflows information. outflows list representing outflows information. water_balance list representing water balance information. output list representing output information.

code: aeme_constructor(   lake,   time,   configuration,   observations,   input,   inflows,   outflows,   water_balance,   output )

title: Constructor function for aeme class — aeme_constructor
text: lake List representing lake information. time List representing time information. configuration List representing configuration information. observations List representing observation information. input List representing input information. inflows List representing inflows information. outflows List representing outflows information. water_balance List representing water balance information. output List representing output information.

what: Align observation depth data with model data — align_depth_data
title: Align observation depth data with model data — align_depth_data
text: Align observation depth data model data

title: Align observation depth data with model data — align_depth_data
Align observation depth data with model data — align_depth_data
text: aeme_data aeme; data object. model vector; models used. Can `dy_cd`, `glm_aed`, `gotm_wet`. var_sim string; variable plot return_df logical; TRUE, return dataframe; FALSE, return list. Default TRUE.

title: Align observation depth data with model data — align_depth_data
text: data frame following columns: Date: Date observation depth: Depth observation elev: Elevation observation Model: Model name var_sim: Variable name value: Value variable depth_from: Depth variable extracted depth_to: Depth variable extracted

title: Build model configuration directories — build_ensemble
text: Configure ensemble lake model simulations basic set inputs.

title: Build model configuration directories — build_ensemble
code: build_ensemble(   aeme_data = NULL,   config = NULL,   model = c("dy_cd", "glm_aed", "gotm_wet"),   mod_ctrls,   inf_factor = c(glm_aed = 1, dy_cd = 1, gotm_wet = 1),   outf_factor = c(glm_aed = 1, dy_cd = 1, gotm_wet = 1),   ext_elev = 0,   use_bgc = TRUE,   calc_wbal = TRUE,   calc_wlev = TRUE,   coeffs = NULL,   hum_type = 3,   overwrite = FALSE,   path = "." )

title: Build model configuration directories — build_ensemble
text: aeme_data aeme; data object. config list; loaded via `config <- yaml::read_yaml("aeme.yaml")` model vector; models used. Can `dy_cd`, `glm_aed`, `gotm_wet`. mod_ctrls dataframe; configuration loaded "mod_ctrls.csv". inf_factor vector; containing numeric factor multiple inflows. Needs named according model. outf_factor vector; containing numeric factor multiple outflows. Needs named according model. ext_elev numeric; extension elevation hypsogrph metres. use_bgc boolean; switch use biogeochemical model. calc_wbal boolean; calculate water balance. calc_wlev boolean; calculate water level. coeffs numeric vector length two; used estimate surface water temperature estimating evaporation. Defaults NULL. water temperature observations included `aeme` object, use build linear relationship air temperature water temperature. Otherwise. uses simple estimation  \(temp_water = 5 + 0.75 * temp_air\) Stefan & Preud'homme, 2007:  www.doi.org/10.1111/j.1752-1688.1993.tb01502.x hum_type numeric; GOTM humidity metric [1=relative humidity ( 2=wet-bulb temperature, 3=dew point temperature, 4=specific humidity (kg/kg)] Default = 3. overwrite boolean; overwrite config files. Default FALSE. path filepath; input files located relative `config`.

title: Build model configuration directories — build_ensemble
text: builds model ensemble configuration. aeme object

title: Build model configuration directories — build_ensemble
code: install.packages("configr", repos = "http://cran.us.r-project.org") #> Installing package into ‘/tmp/Rtmph3FXPk/temp_libpath1ca447249a4f’ #> (as ‘lib’ is unspecified) #> also installing the dependencies ‘ini’, ‘RcppTOML’ tmpdir <- tempdir() aeme_dir <- system.file("extdata/lake/", package = "AEME") # Copy files from package into tempdir file.copy(aeme_dir, tmpdir, recursive = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE path <- file.path(tmpdir, "lake") aeme_data <- yaml_to_aeme(path = path, "aeme.yaml") #> Linking to GEOS 3.10.2, GDAL 3.4.1, PROJ 8.2.1; sf_use_s2() is FALSE #> Warning: Lake area [152343 m2] is different to the area calculated from the lake #> shape [152433.09 m2]. mod_ctrls <- read.csv(file.path(path, "model_controls.csv")) inf_factor = c("glm_aed" = 1) outf_factor = c("glm_aed" = 1) model <- c("glm_aed") build_ensemble(path = path, aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model,                mod_ctrls = mod_ctrls, inf_factor = inf_factor, ext_elev = 5,                use_bgc = FALSE) #> Building simulation for Wainamu [2023-11-15 00:33:33.66975] #> Using observed water level #> Missing values in observed water level #> Using optimisation function #> Calculating outflow with an estimated water balance using lake level, #> inflow data (if present) and estimated evaporation rates. #> Calculating lake level using lake depth and a sinisoidal function. #> Observed lake level is present. Updating initial lake model depth... #> Building GLM3-AED2 model for lake wainamu #> Copied in GLM nml file #> 			   AEME  #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Lake #> Wainamu (ID: 45819); Lat: -36.89; Lon: 174.47; Elev: 23.64m; Depth: 13.07m; #> Area: 152343 m2; Shape file: Present #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Time #> Start: 2022-01-09 Stop: 2022-12-30 Time step: 3600 #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Configuration #>           Physical   |   Biogeochemical #> DY-CD    : Absent     |   Absent  #> GLM-AED  : Present    |   Absent  #> GOTM-WET : Absent     |   Absent  #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Observations #> Lake: Present; Level: Present #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Input #> Inital profile: Present; Inital depth: 13.14m; Hypsograph: Present (n=132); #> Meteo: Present; Use longwave: TRUE; Kw: 0.98 #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Inflows #> Data: Present; Scaling factors: DY-CD: 1; GLM-AED: 1; GOTM-WET: 1 #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Outflows #> Data: Present; Scaling factors: DY-CD: 1; GLM-AED: 1; GOTM-WET: 1 #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Outflows #> Data: Present; Scaling factors: DY-CD: 1; GLM-AED: 1; GOTM-WET: 1 #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Water balance #> Use: obs; Modelled: Absent; Water balance: Present #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Output:  #> DY-CD: Absent #> GLM-AED: Absent #> GOTM-WET: Absent

what: Estimate lake water balance based on a minimal set of inputs — calc_wbal
title: Estimate lake water balance based on a minimal set of inputs — calc_wbal
text: Estimate lake water balance based minimal set inputs

title: Estimate lake water balance based on a minimal set of inputs — calc_wbal
code: calc_wbal(   aeme_time,   model,   use,   hyps,   inf,   outf = NULL,   level = NULL,   obs_lake = NULL,   obs_met,   ext_elev,   elevation,   print_plots = FALSE,   coeffs = NULL )

title: Estimate lake water balance based on a minimal set of inputs — calc_wbal
text: aeme_time list; time object aeme_object using `time()` model vector; models used. Can `dy_cd`, `glm_aed`, `gotm_wet`. hyps data frame hypsographic curve, elevation (masl) planar area (m^2) inf list inflow data frames outf list outflow data frames. Default = NULL level data frame lake water level observations.. cols = Date, value obs_lake data frame lake observations ensemble standard format obs_met data frame meteorology, must include MET_tmpair, MET_wndspd & MET_prvapr, continuous Date, extent defines output extent ext_elev numeric; elevation extend bathymetry elevation numeric; elevation lake print_plots logical; print plots water balance components coeffs numeric vector; coefficients estimating lake surface temperature. Default = NULL method character; method estimating lake water level. Options "use_obs", "sinusoidal", "constant".

title: Estimate lake water balance based on a minimal set of inputs — calc_wbal
text: data frame water balance components : - Date - lvlwtr - HYD_flow -...

text: Generates contour plot z-dimension variables line plot 1-d variables.

title: Plot AEME output — plot_output
code: plot_output(   aeme_data,   model,   var_sim = "HYD_temp",   add_obs = TRUE,   level = FALSE,   label = FALSE,   print_plots = TRUE,   var_lims = NULL,   ylim = NULL,   cumulative = FALSE,   facet = TRUE )

title: Plot AEME output — plot_output
text: aeme_data aeme; data object. model vector; models used. Can `dy_cd`, `glm_aed`, `gotm_wet`. var_sim string; variable plot add_obs boolean; add observations plot level boolean; include lake level. applies contour plots. label boolean; include variable label subtitle contour plots. print_plots boolean; print plots var_lims numeric vector length 2; limits variable. Defaults NULL generate common limits variables. ylim numeric vector length 2; limits y-axis. Defaults NULL calculates based data plotted.

title: Plot AEME output — plot_output
text: list plots z-dimensional variables ggplot2 object 1-d variables.

title: Plot AEME output — plot_output
code: if (FALSE) {   tmpdir <- tempdir()   aeme_dir <- system.file("extdata/lake/", package = "AEME")   # Copy files from package into tempdir   file.copy(aeme_dir, tmpdir, recursive = TRUE)   path <- file.path(tmpdir, "lake")   aeme_data <- yaml_to_aeme(path = path, "aeme.yaml")   mod_ctrls <- read.csv(file.path(path, "model_controls.csv"))   inf_factor = c("dy_cd" = 1, "glm_aed" = 1, "gotm_wet" = 1)   outf_factor = c("dy_cd" = 1, "glm_aed" = 1, "gotm_wet" = 1)   #'   model <- c("glm_aed", "gotm_wet")   build_ensemble(path = path, aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model,                  mod_ctrls = mod_ctrls, inf_factor = inf_factor, ext_elev = 5,                  use_bgc = TRUE)   run_aeme(aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model, verbose = FALSE, path = path,            parallel = TRUE)    aeme_data <- load_output(model = model, aeme_data = aeme_data, path = path,                            mod_ctrls = mod_ctrls, parallel = TRUE)    p1 <- plot_output(aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model,                     var_sim = "HYD_temp", level = TRUE, label = TRUE,                     print_plots = FALSE, var_lims = c(0, 30),                     ylim = c(0, 16))   p1[[1]]    p2 <- plot_output(aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model,                     var_sim = "LKE_evpvol", print_plots = TRUE,                     ylim = c(0, 0.02)) }

title: Plot AEME variable — plot_var
Plot AEME variable — plot_var
code: plot_var(   df = NULL,   aeme_data,   model,   var_sim,   ylim,   xlim,   var_lims,   obs = NULL,   add_obs = TRUE,   level = FALSE,   facet = FALSE,   print_plots = FALSE )

title: Plot AEME variable — plot_var
text: df dataframe; output get_var. NULL, get_var called var_sim used extract variable interest aeme_data model. aeme_data aeme; data object. model vector; models used. Can `dy_cd`, `glm_aed`, `gotm_wet`. var_sim string; variable plot ylim numeric vector length 2; limits y-axis. Defaults NULL calculates based data plotted. var_lims numeric vector length 2; limits variable. Defaults NULL generate common limits variables. obs list; output observations add_obs boolean; add observations plot level boolean; include lake level. applies contour plots. facet logical; TRUE, variables depth, plot model separate facet. FALSE, plot model separate plot return list plots. TRUE, variables without depth, plot model separate facet. FALSE, plot model separate line return plot. applies variables without depth component. print_plots boolean; print plots

title: Plot AEME variable — plot_var

Run aquatic model ensemble — run_aeme
Run aquatic model ensemble — run_aeme
code: run_aeme(   aeme_data,   model,   return = TRUE,   mod_ctrls = NULL,   nlev = NULL,   verbose = FALSE,   debug = FALSE,   timeout = 0,   parallel = FALSE,   check_output = FALSE,   path = "." )

title: Run aquatic model ensemble — run_aeme
text: aeme_data aeme; data object. model vector; models used. Can `dy_cd`, `glm_aed`, `gotm_wet`. return logical; return model output within `aeme` object? Defaults TRUE. mod_ctrls dataframe; configuration loaded "mod_ctrls.csv". nlev numeric; number levels return model output. NULL, calculates number levels based lake depth provided within hypsograph. lake less thatn 3m deep, outputs every 0.1m, else greater 3m, outputs every 0.33m. Defaults NULL. verbose logical; print model output console. Defaults FALSE. debug logical; write debug log (DYRESM). Defaults FALSE. timeout timeout seconds, ignored 0.  limit     elapsed time running command separate process.   Fractions     seconds ignored. parallel logical; run models parallel. Defaults FALSE. check_output logical; check model output running? Defaults FALSE. path filepath; input files located relative `config`.

title: Run aquatic model ensemble — run_aeme
Run aquatic model ensemble — run_aeme
code: if (FALSE) { tmpdir <- tempdir() aeme_dir <- system.file("extdata/lake/", package = "AEME") # Copy files from package into tempdir file.copy(aeme_dir, tmpdir, recursive = TRUE) path <- file.path(tmpdir, "lake") aeme_data <- yaml_to_aeme(path = path, "aeme.yaml") mod_ctrls <- read.csv(file.path(path, "model_controls.csv")) inf_factor = c("glm_aed" = 1) outf_factor = c("glm_aed" = 1) model <- c("glm_aed") build_ensemble(path = path, aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model,                mod_ctrls = mod_ctrls, inf_factor = inf_factor, ext_elev = 5,                use_bgc = TRUE) run_aeme(aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model, verbose = TRUE, path = path,           return = FALSE) }

code: if (FALSE) { sim_folder <- run_example_sim(verbose = FALSE) nml_file <- file.path(sim_folder, 'glm3.nml') glm_nml <- read_nml(nml_file) get_nml_value(glm_nml, arg_name = 'Kw') glm_nml <- set_nml(glm_nml, arg_name = 'Kw', arg_val = 1.4) glm_nml <- set_nml(glm_nml, arg_list = list('Kw' = 1.4)) print(glm_nml) }

title: Write a yaml object to file — write_yaml
Write a yaml object to file — write_yaml
code: if (FALSE) { config_file <- system.file("extdata/feeagh/LakeEnsemblR.yaml", package = "LakeEnsemblR")  yaml <- read_yaml(config_file) yaml <- set_yaml(yaml, value = 23, key1 = "location", key2 = "latitude") yaml <- set_yaml(yaml, value = "2010-06-01 00:00:00", key1 = "time", key2 = "start") yaml <- set_yaml(yaml, value = "meteo.csv", key1 = "input", key2 = "meteo", key3 = "file") yaml <- set_yaml(yaml, value = TRUE, key1 = "calibration", key2 = "GOTM", key3 = "turb_param/k_min", key4 = "log") yaml <- set_yaml(yaml, value = c("temp", "salt"), key1 = "output", key2 = "variables")  write_yaml(yaml, "LakeEnsemblR.yaml") }
